comment: Personally, I would take another professor. This class was an easy A but she is a very tough grader and would criticize everything. There were also a ton of assignments due every week in D2L and in the textbook. She is very passionate about the language but I had a hard time learning from this professor.

Do NOT take this professor. This is the easiest class on my list of classes this year and I am failing. Not because of the difficulty of the assignments, but because her descriptions of the assignments are very vague to the point where you don't even know what she is asking you to do. She doesn't include everything due for the week in the modules.

Her class is not very hard, but she is very unwilling to let you redo, retake, or submit any late assignments. This is very discouraging and ridiculous for an elementary class. If you make a mistake, she makes it feel like you can't fix or learn from it. This class was only as challenging as it is because of her. She doesn't care if you pass or not

Think extra hard on deciding to take any of her classes is where Ill start. We started off this semester with a horribly structured walkthrough video to lay out the course work. Everything you submit will be graded as if it is a 3000-4000 level course with the assumption that you have cheated with a translator. Some are scared to even email her.

Professor R. is quite ridiculous. I only took this class for two weeks and knew I needed to drop immediately before it affected my academic career. She doesn't care about the students just is ready to pick everything you do wrong on an assignment apart. For the sake of your grade take another course. Tests are weirdly formatted as well. AVOID NOW
She is intense but it is because she wants you to learn. She cares about her students and wants all of them to succeed. I hope I get to take her again bc I learned so much.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: If you can handle being gaslit and emotionally toyed with this is the class for you. I have never felt so anxious going to a class in my college career. She will belittle you and make you feel dumb. Says she is open to communication but will gladly victimize herself. There are other Spanish professors at KSU just saying! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

IF YOU SUFFER FROM SEVERE ANXIETY DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! she is horrible and has no compassion for any of her students if you get an answer wrong, she'll make you feel stupid! logging into her class every MWF was so stressful because I never knew who she was going to yell at next. She treated a basic class as if it was a graduate school level class

DO NOT TAKE HER! She is an unfair grader and she plays favorites in the classroom. She came in half way through the semester and changed everything. She treated this 1001 class as if it was a 3000 level class. She gives an insane amount of work. She says to try and if you make a mistake it is okay, but then. ridicules and yells at you when make one

Worst class I have ever taken. She is pretentious and disrespectful. Her instructions are unclear and she grades very hard. DO NOT take her classes. I am a good student and I only made a C. I worked really hard in her class, always participated, and learned a lot but NEVER felt like my grades reflected that. Super discouraging.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I hated this class! She is such a tough grader and the class is so unorganized. The textbook work doesnt line up with the due dates for the rest of the module. She will constanly think you are using a translator. She also won't respond to emails and she's very passive agressive and will call you out infront of the whole class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I am taking this class online for summer 2020 , I can't speak for how she is in person but online she is TERRIBLE. You have homework in an online textbook that you have to pay for about 3 assignments every other day that's not counting the online D2L assignments you will get throughout the week and to make it fun Add a Quiz or Oral exam. DONTTAKE

Online for summer 2020, wish i never took this class to begin with, many indiviudal projects and HW which were time consuming and everything was just very unorganized. She is very kind but this class is TOO much.

Extremely passionate. Class is very difficult, but as a Spanish major, it's one of the most helpful classes you'll ever take. Can't speak for her lower-level Spanish classes, but I'd recommend against her level 3000s if you're a Spanish minor/ looking for something easy. Overall amazing professor -- but makes you work for your grade.

I took Professor Rustamova for two semesters and loved her!!! She truly wants to help her students improve their spanish. Participation matters and attendance is mandatory but this is where you get to practice speaking

I took this class for level 1001 and 1002 and loved both classes. This woman truly cares for her students and pushes them to really work hard and do their best. Participation is extremely important, but it's never anything too difficult. I would highly recommend her!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Took this class Spring 2019, not as difficult as ratings would suggest. Really cares about the language and tries to connect with students and focus on individual needs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: As long as you pay attention and put effort in it is a pretty easy class. She makes sure you learn the material. I respect her as a teacher and I would take her again!

Her Spanish class is pretty easy as long as you keep up with the work and study. Participation is key so make sure you show up to class. She really cares about her students and I would take her again.

Would recommend. She may come across harsh at first, but you'll come to appreciate it because she keeps her class well under control which helps everybody learn and not waste time. She is very good at teaching the concepts and is always open to questions. Her grading is very fair, if not maybe even slightly lenient.

I have taken courses taught by Dra Rustamova for the past two semesters. I received B's for both semesters with minimal effort. If you do the work and at least try to improve your Spanish she is more than willing to work with you to improve your grades. She may seem standoffish at first but it is obvious she cares.

I tried to switch Spanish classes but there weren't any others with spots open. She isn't helpful at all and always has the worst attitude. I really don't understand how she became a teacher. I just want to be good at Spanish but she makes it so hard and seem impossible.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She has a bad attitude and can be irrational in class. Pass on taking her and take someone else.

If you've never had Spanish before DON'T TAKE HER! She usually has an attitude and doesn't tolerate mistakes. However, if you've had Spanish before you'll do well, as the class is otherwise very easy. There are 2 tests and a cumulative final. Participation is worth 10% and attendance is mandatory. There's also homework on Connect that's worth 20%.

Dra. Rustamova is a wonderful professor; she really cares about her students, and wants to see them succeed. She is someone that is worthy of respect, and she is very intelligent. You will have to read a lot in this class, and participation matters, but it's worth the effort because you will learn so much about the Spanish language and culture.

She created her own curriculum for this class about the Franco era. The integration of five film reviews and the discussion afterwards in class was very interesting. She knows how to engage students and encourage conversation. She gives top quality instruction, and she requires students to come to class prepared. Work hard and you will learn much.

she's the worst professor ever. if your'e not good at spanish she will automatically treat you differently than everyone else. when you tell her your'e confused or don't remember something shell spend time telling you that she cant learn it for you and you have to learn it yourself rather than helping you understand. talks like you're stupid.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very moody, every time you go into class be ready for her to be in a bad mood. She gets really mad for not completely understanding spanish quickly even though this is a first year class. Make sure you're absolutely silent, if not she will get really mad. use practice textbook. she won't help you, you have to figure it out yourself. go to a tutor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Never would I ever recommend this professor. She is completely unrealistic with her expectations and she treats you like an idiot for not knowing Spanish fluently within 2 weeks of taking the class. Tests are all short answer in full sentences and the homework is not anything like the test, and is not even close to an effective practice.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I am fairly good at languages and already have Italian and French but this class was not well articulated. Hard to follow, a little messy, very hard grader (for the writings) and most of it not really approachable. Also hard to know what kind of mood she is going to be in. I don't recommend her for an intro Spanish class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This is not a show up and pass class, you will have to work for it. she's a great professor though, cares a lot about her students. Expect to read A LOT and participation is NOT optional. Try hard and it will pay off. Tests, quizzes, hw, big paper, participation, all part of grade. She's outstanding if you show up and care.

I am usually an A/B student in spanish and it took everything I had to earn a C in this course. VERY tough grader, extensive homework every single night. Expect to spend more time for her class than any other. Accessible for help, yet does not lecture in class. She relies on class discussion to teach the material and does not reinforce it.
